messages.message: @Heymian / @Anil any further comments on this? I'm motivated to see some kind of solution here, since it's quite hard to tell which API endpoints are actually public/user-facing by looking at the code.

I like the idea of moving things to private.
Should there be a version too like /api/private/v2/?
v2/v1 is used to define APIs that follow rest/don’t
This can be done progressively too
I’m onboard with the /private and /internal namespace going forward! I’m not sure we need to version private, given we can change those fairly freely
@Anil the other ideal state is all public /v2 endpoints must move to the OpenAPI structure
But I think that will take a bit of effort, so maybe we start with new API’s only
